pageContext.claim: “Barack Obama left me 142 federal judges, nothing like that's ever happened, nothing. Very rarely does it -- You know, when you're a President everyone, you leave, every one of them is filled. Those are the most important things you can have, Federal judgeships, lifetime appointments. It's such a big deal, he left me 142.”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
